thread.title: Clubhouse Live ditches green and gold for pink
thread.title_full: Clubhouse Live ditches green and gold for pink

title: Clubhouse Live ditches green and gold for pink
text:
Clubhouse Live ditches green and gold for pink Brett Christopherson , Post-Crescent Media 2:15 p.m. CDT October 15, 2015 Fans attending Monday's Clubhouse Live are asked to wear pink in support of breast cancer awareness. Items on sale will benefit Susan G. Komen. Clubhouse Live can be seen Mondays at 6:30 p.m. from The Clubhouse in downtown Appleton. (Photo: Gannett Wisconsin Media) 
The Green Bay Packers aren’t the only team off to a great start this season. 
Same goes for our Clubhouse Live crew, which has embraced Packers left tackle David Bakhtiari as the show’s new co-host as we continue to adhere to our successful game plan of mixing in a pinch of Xs and Os talk with a heaping helping of entertaining and interesting non-football chatter. 
For instance, we found out guard Josh Walker is an avid outdoorsman who hooked a prize musky this past spring while fishing the Fox River. That’s cool. 
Running back Eddie Lacy is a talented beat boxer — when incessantly egged on. That’s hilarious. 
Tight end Justin Perillo credits basketball in aiding his continued growth as a football player. That’s different. 
Defensive back Micah Hyde said he “knows for a fact” he’s “fourth or fifth on the depth chart” at quarterback. That’s interesting — and a scenario no Packers fan wants to see. Sorry, Micah. 
And none of them can spell Bakhtiari. That’s amusing. 
So far, so fun for all of us. 
But Clubhouse Live can also strike a serious tone at times. Take Monday’s upcoming show in which we’re asking those who attend to wear pink in support of breast cancer awareness. 
We’ll have items on sale that will benefit Susan G. Komen , like T-shirts and cupcakes. Cash or checks only, please. And we’ll have some cool pink prizes, too. John Kuhn spearheads effort to help homeless mothers 
Look for other details and guest information on our Facebook page at facebook.com/clubhouselive . 
The award-winning Clubhouse Live is produced by Gannett Wisconsin Media and can be seen at 6:30 p.m. Mondays from The Clubhouse Sports Pub & Grill inside the Radisson Paper Valley Hotel in downtown Appleton. Look for it online, as well, at clubhouselive.com . 
The fight against breast cancer is an important cause for many. That we can use Clubhouse Live as a way to do some good for the community is a source of pride for our entire team. 
Please consider attending the show and supporting this movement. 
Brett Christopherson: 920-993-7117, or brett.christopherson@gannettwisconsin.com; on Twitter @PCBrettC 2 CONNECT 9 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://post.cr/1Lw80kQ TOP VIDEOS
